content: Nature & Gathering
Friends & Connections

Walk up to the Cooking Counter and <style=Highlight_Teaching>press F</style> to use it. <style=Highlight_Teaching>Left-click</style> to select 2 ingredients, then select the appropriate kitchenware to start cooking.

Walk up to the Cooking Counter and <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the cooking button</style> to use it. <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tap</style> to select 2 ingredients, then select the appropriate kitchenware to start cooking.

<style=Highlight_Teaching>Click</style> to enter a Neighbor's Planette and view their <style=Highlight_Teaching>story</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>journey</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>logs</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>profile</style>, and <style=Highlight_Teaching>growth</style>.

Your Neighbor's Planette can also grow and has a <style=Highlight_Teaching>Growth Stage</style>.
Planettes need <style=Highlight_Teaching>Archiboos</style> to grow. Archiboos will help your Neighbor take care of their Planette and make it better.
Collect Archiboos so more of them can tend to the Planette and increase its Growth Stage.

The cafe is split into Public Rooms and Private Rooms. In the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Public Room</style>, you can chat freely with everyone in the store, while <style=Highlight_Teaching>Private Rooms</style> are created by the room owner and are only accessible by invited friends. Invite friends to private rooms through <style=Highlight_Teaching>Yoohoo</style>, or they can request to join through Yoohoo as well.
How do I visit?
Daily Life
Daily Life

<style=Highlight_Teaching>Click</style> the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style> in the bottom right corner of the screen to open it. With the Tool Wheel open, <style=Highlight_Teaching>click</style> the tool that you want to use and swap out the currently equipped tool.

Inspo Cards contain crafting recipes for different furniture items. Open your Backpack and use an Inspo Card to <style=Highlight_Teaching>Create</style> and learn how to craft a piece of furniture and the different materials required. Once you've gathered the necessary materials, use a <style=Highlight_Teaching>DIY Bench</style> to craft the desired piece of furniture.

Near cliffs or rivers, you can build pathways using <style=Highlight_Teaching>bridges</style>.
Take out a bridge from your Backpack, find a suitable placement area, and click <style=Highlight_Teaching>Confirm</style> to create a path.
You can rotate and move them to find the best position.
Both ends of a bridge must connect to riverbanks or cliffs to be placed.
How do I use Luca Fruits to embellish the planet?
How do I invite a Neighbor to a Starsea Voyage?
Nature & Gathering
Friends & Connections
Approach a fruit tree and <style=Highlight_Teaching>left-click</style> to shake it.

Select the fishing rod from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>. With the fishing rod equipped, look for <style=Highlight_Teaching>fish shadows</style> beneath the water's surface.
<style=Highlight_Teaching>Hold the fishing rod button</style> and <style=Highlight_Teaching>drag</style> to adjust the position of the bobber. Wait for a fish to bite, which will cause the bobber to bob below the water's surface. When you get a bite, <style=Highlight_Teaching>hold the fishing rod button</style> to reel the fish in.

Select the insect net from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>. With the insect net equipped, approach any <style=Highlight_Teaching>insect</style>, aim at your target, and <style=Highlight_Teaching>left-click</style> to swing and catch it.

The <style=Highlight_Teaching>Luca Fruits</style> from Neighbor Planettes can embellish planets, transforming the appearance of mountains, plains, beaches, and the sky.
Place the Luca Fruit on the Luca Arbor to change your planet's appearance.

Cooking dishes increases your <style=Highlight_Teaching>proficiency</style>. As proficiency rises, the chance of making higher-quality dishes also increases. Using better ingredients also helps you create higher-quality dishes, which sell at a higher <style=Highlight_Teaching>price</style> and restore more <style=Highlight_Teaching>Strength</style> when consumed.

Chatting, giving gifts, and completing tasks for your Neighbors daily will increase your Bond.
Your first chat of the day with a Neighbor will increase your Bond.
You can give one gift to your Neighbor per day. Different gifts will increase your Bond by different amounts.
How do I view a Neighbor's Planette?
About Homi Decor
Nature & Gathering

When you max out Bond Lv. 1 with a Neighbor, you can invite them to live on your planet.
Talk to your Neighbor and select the option to <style=Highlight_Teaching>invite them to settle</style>.

Listen to the resident's interior design ideas, open Homi Decor on your phone, and accept their home design request.
After completing the request, you'll receive thank-you gifts according to their <style=Highlight_Teaching>satisfaction</style> level.
How do I till soil?
How do I use recipes?
How do I use the paint roller?
Friends & Connections

Select the shellfish tongs from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>. Equip your shellfish tongs and approach a <style=Highlight_Teaching>shore-dweller</style>. <style=Highlight_Teaching>Hold the left mouse button</style> to sneak, then move closer to it. Take aim at the shore-dweller, then <style=Highlight_Teaching>release the left mouse button</style> to catch it.

When you create a new dish, it will be recorded in your recipe book.
While cooking, switch to <style=Highlight_Teaching>Recipe Mode</style> to quickly prepare dishes you've already learned.
Secret recipes gifted by Neighbors can only be cooked in <style=Highlight_Teaching>Recipe Mode</style>.
How do I use Inspo Cards?
Daily Life
How do I get fruits?
How do I use bridges or ramps?
How do I invite a Neighbor to a Starsea Voyage?
Basics
Neighbor Interactions
Neighbor Interactions

Select the insect net from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>. With the insect net equipped, approach any <style=Highlight_Teaching>insect</style>, aim at your target, and <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the button</style> to swing and catch it.

Select the shellfish tongs from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>. Equip your shellfish tongs and approach a <style=Highlight_Teaching>shore-dweller</style>. <style=Highlight_Teaching>Hold the button</style> to sneak, then move closer to it. Take aim at the shore-dweller, then <style=Highlight_Teaching>release the button</style> to catch it.

After inviting a Neighbor to <style=Highlight_Teaching>settle</style>, you'll be able to invite them to join you on a Starsea Voyage.
Each Neighbor has unique travel goals and abilities that can help you during the journey.
How do I cook?
About Archiboos
Friends & Connections
How do I get fruits?
How to Raise Bond Lv. with Neighbors?
About Homi Decor
How do I place an order in the cafe?
Nature & Gathering
Neighbor Interactions

Open the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Map</style> from your Phone.
You can see your location as well as the locations of your Neighbors and facilities on the map.

<style=Highlight_Teaching>Luca</style> is the vitality of growth in all things, possessing the power to nurture planets.
When Lucaseeds are planted on a planet, they connect with it, nourishing the world and fostering different ecosystems and landscapes, making life better for everyone who calls the planet their home.

While you are going about your business, you may encounter your planet's mystical spirits known as <style=Highlight_Teaching>Archiboos</style>.
White Archiboos are omnivorous and the most common type, though you might occasionally come across different color variants.
How do I help Neighbors decorate their homes?
Nature & Gathering
Neighbor Interactions
Neighbor Interactions

Select the paint roller from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>.
With the paint roller equipped, choose a ground pattern and <style=Highlight_Teaching>left-click</style> on an empty area to paint it.
You can use different painting methods to adjust the forms of corners and edges.

After <style=Highlight_Teaching>helping decorate a Neighbor's home</style>, you can help upgrade their house on the <style=Highlight_Teaching>following day</style>.
Listen to their wishes about their home to obtain their <style=Highlight_Teaching>House Blueprint</style>.
From <style=Highlight_Teaching>Loomi Mart</style>, accept the Neighbor's house order to help upgrade their home.
About Growth Stage
Approach a fruit tree and <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the tree-shaking button</style> to shake it and obtain the fallen fruit.

Raise the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Growth Stage</style> of your Neighbor's Planette until it's fully grown for it to produce a Luca Fruit.
Your Neighbor will gift the Planette's Luca Fruit to you, the Planetkeeper, for decorating your planet.

In the Galactic Bazaar, <style=Highlight_Teaching>press Enter</style> to open the chat box.
You can freely chat with others and see their messages when you become friends, sit next to each other, or sit while facing each other.
You can also freely chat with strangers in open chat zones like the bonfire area and the Help Hub.
Strangers cannot see each other's chat messages.
How do I obtain new Luca Fruits?
How do I cook?
About Archiboos
Neighbor Interactions
How to Raise Bond Lv. with Neighbors?
How do I chat with others?
Nature & Gathering

Select the fishing rod from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>. With the fishing rod equipped, look for a <style=Highlight_Teaching>fish's shadow </style> beneath the water's surface.
<style=Highlight_Teaching>Hold down the left mouse button</style> and <style=Highlight_Teaching>move the mouse</style> to adjust the position of the bobber. Wait for a fish to bite, which will cause the bobber to bob below the water's surface.
When you get a bite, <style=Highlight_Teaching>hold down the left mouse button</style> to reel the fish in.

When visiting a Starmigo's planet, you can <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the Visit Bar</style> to return home.
Once your Starmigo grants permission, you can use all tools and access your backup Backpack to temporarily store collected resources.
When you leave or end your visit, resources in your backup Backpack will be transferred to your personal inventory.

Inspo Cards contain crafting recipes for different furniture items. Open your Backpack and use an Inspo Card to <style=Highlight_Teaching>Create</style> and learn how to craft a piece of furniture and the different materials required. Once you've gathered the necessary materials, use a <style=Highlight_Teaching>DIY Bench</style> to craft the desired piece of furniture.

In multiplayer areas like the Galactic Bazaar, find strangers you'd like to befriend and <style=Highlight_Teaching>click</style> the friend button above their head to send a friend request.
When you receive friend requests from others, you can accept them in <style=Highlight_Teaching>Yoohoo</style> to become friends.
How do I go beachcombing?
About Homi Decor
Daily Life
Daily Life

Tap <style=Highlight_Teaching>Invite</style> in Yoohoo to invite friends to meet up, or travel to their location.
When visiting a friend, tap the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Multiplayer Management</style> button to manage your connection.
In Multiplayer Management, you can end the connection or head home.

Your Neighbor's Planette can also grow and has a <style=Highlight_Teaching>Growth Stage</style>.
Planettes need <style=Highlight_Teaching>Archiboos</style> to grow. Archiboos will help your Neighbor take care of their Planette and make it better.
Collect Archiboos so more of them can tend to the Planette and increase its Growth Stage.
When the Planette levels up, your Neighbor will send you a thank-you gift.

After inviting a Neighbor to <style=Highlight_Teaching>settle</style>, you'll be able to invite them to join you on a Starsea Voyage.
Each Neighbor has unique travel goals and abilities that can help you during the journey.

Select the shovel from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>. Find an empty space and <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the button</style> to till the soil. <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tap the button again</style> on tilled soil to flatten pits into even terrain.
About Homi Decor
About Cafe rooms
When near an item, <style=Highlight_Teaching>press F</style> to pick it up.

In <style=Highlight_Teaching>Precision Farming mode</style>, face a plant and <style=Highlight_Teaching>left-click</style> to dig it up.
With the shovel still equipped, <style=Highlight_Teaching>left-click</style> again to plant it in tilled soil.

Select the paint roller from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>.
With the paint roller equipped, choose a ground pattern and <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the paint roller button</style> on an empty area to paint it.
You can use different painting methods to adjust the forms of corners and edges.

Starcove records the current <style=Highlight_Teaching>Bond</style> between you and your Neighbors.
As Bond increases, you can access more interactions and events with your Neighbors, and your conversations will also become deeper.

<style=Highlight_Teaching>Sit down</style> before the counter in the cafe to order the coffee you want. Talk to the barista Nalo if you'd like to treat someone. Sometimes, you might be invited for a coffee too!

Once you become close enough with a Neighbor, you can invite them to live on your planet.
Talk to the Neighbor and tap <style=Highlight_Teaching>Invite</style> to ask for their thoughts on settling.
About Strength
Basics

Before starting a Starsea trip, click the <style=Highlight_Teaching>"+" button</style> to choose your travel companions. You can invite up to <style=Highlight_Teaching>2</style> Neighbors per trip.
Neighbors who are busy cannot be invited.
Each Neighbor has unique travel preferences and abilities, which can be viewed in the panel before departure.

The cafe is split into Public Rooms and Private Rooms. In the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Public Room</style>, you can chat freely with everyone in the store, while <style=Highlight_Teaching>Private Rooms</style> are created by the room owner and are only accessible by invited friends. Invite friends to private rooms through <style=Highlight_Teaching>Yoohoo</style>, or they can request to join through Yoohoo as well.

Daily Life

Select the shovel from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>. Find an empty space and <style=Highlight_Teaching>left-click</style> to till the soil. <style=Highlight_Teaching>Left-click</style> again on the tilled land to flatten it.

In <style=Highlight_Teaching>Precision Farming mode</style>, face a plant and <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the button</style> to dig it up.
With the shovel still equipped, <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the button again</style> to plant it in tilled soil.

<style=Highlight_Teaching>Press Tab</style> or <style=Highlight_Teaching>click</style> the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style> button in the bottom right corner to open the Tool Wheel.
In the Tool Wheel, <style=Highlight_Teaching>click</style> a tool to switch to it.
<style=Highlight_Teaching>Hold and drag a tool</style> to another slot to change its order.

Using tools consumes <style=Highlight_Teaching>Strength</style>. The strength bar <style=Highlight_Teaching>shows your remaining Strength</style>.
You won't be able to use tools if you run out of Strength.

While you are going about your business, you may encounter your planet's mystical spirits known as <style=Highlight_Teaching>Archiboos</style>.
White Archiboos are omnivorous and the most common type, though you might occasionally come across different color variants.

In multiplayer areas like the Galactic Bazaar, find strangers you'd like to befriend and <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap</style> the friend button above their head to send a friend request.
When you receive friend requests from others, you can accept them in <style=Highlight_Teaching>Yoohoo</style> to become friends.

Chat with Esassani and head to the Galactic Bazaar.
Find <style=Highlight_Teaching>Cafe Untamed</style> near the hillside to the right of the Galactic Bazaar stage, and enter the cafe.

When near an item, <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the Pick Up button</style> to collect it.

Near cliffs or rivers, you can build pathways using <style=Highlight_Teaching>bridges</style>.
Take out a bridge from your Backpack, find a suitable placement area, and click <style=Highlight_Teaching>Confirm</style> to create a path.
You can rotate and move them to find the best position.
Both ends of a bridge must connect to riverbanks or cliffs to be placed.

Starcove records the current <style=Highlight_Teaching>Bond</style> between you and your Neighbors.
As Bond increases, you can access more interactions and events with your Neighbors, and your conversations will also become deeper.
To increase your Bond, you can <style=Highlight_Teaching>chat</style> with them daily and give them <style=Highlight_Teaching>gifts</style> to find out their preferences.
Giving <style=Highlight_Teaching>gifts they like</style> will additionally increase your <style=Highlight_Teaching>Bond</style>.

<style=Highlight_Teaching>The day after you finish decorating a Neighbor's home</style>, they will send a Homi Decor request.
To start helping the Neighbors with home renovation, you'll need to install Homi Decor on your Phone with <style=Highlight_Teaching>Mobai</style>.
Completing your Neighbor's house order according to their needs will increase their satisfaction. You'll receive gifts and exclusive furniture Inspo Cards from them in return.

How do I visit?

You can freely chat with others and see their messages when you become friends, sit next to each other, or sit while facing each other.

Daily Life

Advance your Neighbor's Growth Stage to receive exclusive gifts, such as exclusive Reactions, furniture Inspo Cards, and more.
When your Neighbor reaches the maximum Growth Stage, you'll receive the exclusive Luca Fruit from their Planette.

<style=Highlight_Teaching>Archiboos</style> can help care for your Neighbor's Planette and boost its Growth Stage.
As you raise a Neighbor's Growth Stage, you'll receive exclusive rewards such as special Reactions and furniture Inspo Cards.
When a Neighbor's Planette reaches its maximum Growth Stage, you'll receive its unique Luca Fruit.
How do I reel in the line?
How do I acquire colored Archiboos?
How do I increase the Growth Stage?
Daily Life

Some saltwater fish require you to adjust the drag of the fishing line repeatedly.
<style=Highlight_Teaching>Hold down the fishing rod button</style> to reel in the line. Observe carefully, and adjust your reeling strength on the go.
When the line turns red, quickly <style=Highlight_Teaching>release the button</style> to loosen the line.
Keep adjusting the drag until you successfully catch the fish.

Red Archiboos are lithovorous and may appear when mining, digging, or picking mushrooms.
Blue Archiboos are aquavorous and may appear when fishing, beachcombing, or watering plants.

Some saltwater fish require you to adjust the drag of the fishing line repeatedly.
<style=Highlight_Teaching>Hold down the fishing rod button</style> to reel in the line. Observe carefully, and adjust your reeling strength on the go.
When the line turns red, quickly <style=Highlight_Teaching>release the button</style> to loosen the line.
Keep adjusting the drag until you successfully catch the fish.

Green Archiboos are herbivorous and may appear when shaking trees, catching bugs, planting, picking, or harvesting crops. Yellow Archibos are artivores and may appear when cooking, crafting, or chopping trees.
Daily Life

Red Archiboos are lithovorous and may appear when mining, digging, or picking mushrooms.
Blue Archiboos are aquavorous and may appear when fishing, beachcombing, or watering plants.

Green Archiboos are herbivorous and may appear when shaking trees, catching bugs, planting, picking, or harvesting crops. Yellow Archibos are artivores and may appear when cooking, crafting, or chopping trees.

How do I play the rhythm challenge?
Neighbor Interactions
Neighbor Interactions
Neighbor Interactions

You can also boost Bond by completing Neighbor tasks.
In <style=Highlight_Teaching>Neighbor Memo</style>, look for tasks with Bond rewards. Finishing them will raise your Bond Level.

When you reach <style=Highlight_Teaching>maximum Bond</style> for your current Bond Level with a Neighbor, complete the <style=Highlight_Teaching>upgrade conditions</style> to increase your Bond Level.
You can check the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Bond conditions</style> in <style=Highlight_Teaching>Starcove</style>.
You can also check tasks marked with the Bond icon in the Neighbor Memo. Completing these tasks will <style=Highlight_Teaching>increase your Bond Level</style>.

The Rhythm Challenge is a team-based score game that tests your sense of rhythm and memory.
Before starting, please <style=Highlight_Teaching>adjust your sound settings</style> to ensure you can hear the music.

The Rhythm Challenge is a team-based score game that tests your sense of rhythm and memory.
Before starting, please <style=Highlight_Teaching>adjust your sound settings</style> to ensure you can hear the music.

In the Rhythm Challenge, you need to mimic the host's reactions and perform them to the rhythm.
The challenge is divided into host rounds and challenger rounds. During the host's round, pay attention to host Aleo's moves and memorize the reactions he makes on the beats.

In the Rhythm Challenge, you need to mimic the host's reactions and perform them to the rhythm.
The challenge is divided into host rounds and challenger rounds. During the host's round, pay attention to host Aleo's moves and memorize the reactions he makes on the beats.
During the challenger's round, you need to tap the corresponding button for the reaction performed on the beat by the host earlier and replicate his move to score.

In Starcove, you can view your Neighbor's <style=Highlight_Teaching>preferences</style> for gifts. Giving a Neighbor gifts they <style=Highlight_Teaching>love</style> or <style=Highlight_Teaching>like</style> will grant extra Bond, while gifts they <style=Highlight_Teaching>dislike</style> will be returned.

In Starcove, you can view your Neighbor's <style=Highlight_Teaching>preferences</style> for gifts. Giving a Neighbor gifts they <style=Highlight_Teaching>love</style> or <style=Highlight_Teaching>like</style> will grant extra Bond, while gifts they <style=Highlight_Teaching>dislike</style> will be returned.

You can also boost Bond by completing Neighbor tasks.
In <style=Highlight_Teaching>Neighbor Memo</style>, look for tasks with Bond rewards. Finishing them will raise your Bond Level.

When you reach <style=Highlight_Teaching>maximum Bond</style> for your current Bond Level with a Neighbor, complete the <style=Highlight_Teaching>upgrade conditions</style> to increase your Bond Level.
You can check the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Bond conditions</style> in <style=Highlight_Teaching>Starcove</style>.
You can also check tasks marked with the Bond icon in the Neighbor Memo. Completing these tasks will <style=Highlight_Teaching>increase your Bond Level</style>.
During the challenger's round, you need to press the corresponding button for the reaction performed on the beat by the host earlier and replicate his move to score.

Set up themed <style=Highlight_Teaching>Blueprints</style> to invite residents to your exhibition and earn rewards.
After obtaining a Blueprint, select and place it from your Backpack, then decorate it with items or furniture based on the display requirements.
Once complete, you can invite residents to visit and receive a rating. You'll earn rewards based on the rating.
Items already placed in the Blueprint can be picked up and moved around as a group.

Items with a <style=Highlight_Teaching>thumbs-up icon</style> in the required list are Wishlist Furniture pieces that your Neighbor loves. Submitting these pieces will improve your rating and is essential for achieving a five-star satisfaction rating.
Your Neighbor will open their Backpack, and you'll get to pick an outfit for them.

Open the Camera and tap the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Group Photo</style> button to invite available Neighbors nearby to take a photo together.

Inspo Cards are stored inside the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Inspo Card Binder</style>.
In the Inspo Card Binder, you can browse card sets, preview <style=Highlight_Teaching>designs</style>, and check <style=Highlight_Teaching>ways to obtain</style> the cards.
To open the Inspo Card Binder, interact with the DIY Bench, or access it through your Phone.

The <style=Highlight_Teaching>Optional</style> list shows your Neighbor's furniture preferences. Submitting furniture that matches these preferences will result in a higher satisfaction rating.
When the cumulative rating reaches the limit for satisfaction, the rating will no longer increase.

You can also <style=Highlight_Teaching>switch to your own Backpack</style> to select an outfit and <style=Highlight_Teaching>share</style> it with your Neighbor.
Once unequipped or replaced by another piece for the same slot, shared outfits will return to your Backpack.

After the Luca Arbor is upgraded, the planet will grow <style=Highlight_Teaching>new environments</style> and unlock <style=Highlight_Teaching>new features</style>.

After a Neighbor agrees to settle down, find <style=Highlight_Teaching>Mobai</style> to pick up the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Building Kit</style>.
Place the Building Kit in a suitable location on your planet, and the Neighbor will move in after the construction is complete.
On Starcove's <style=Highlight_Teaching>Growth</style> page, click on an Archiboo to check the quantity you own and ways to obtain this type of Archiboo. You can also view more detailed entries here.

When your Strength runs out, open the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Backpack</style> and select <style=Highlight_Teaching>Food</style>.
After selecting, click <style=Highlight_Teaching>Consume</style> to restore Strength.

Press <style=Highlight_Teaching>Z</style> or hold <style=Highlight_Teaching>Alt</style> to show the cursor and open the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Loomi Footprints</style> handbook issued by Loomi Co.
You can check Footprint tasks in Loomi Footprints. Complete them to earn <style=Highlight_Teaching>Loomi</style> rewards.

When approaching furniture with empty hands, <style=Highlight_Teaching>hold the button</style> to arrange the furniture.
<style=Highlight_Teaching>Swipe the screen</style> to adjust furniture position. <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tap the Rotate button</style> to rotate it.
Once you've found the perfect spot, <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap confirm</style> to place the furniture.
Approach the furniture and <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the Store button</style> to store it.

When crafting furniture or browsing the Inspo Card Binder, you can track the materials you need as objectives.
After <style=Highlight_Teaching>tracking</style> the materials, their locations will be shown in the area.
<style=Highlight_Teaching>Press V</style> while in the area to switch between different tracked materials.

Wall and roof furniture must be placed near corresponding walls or ceilings.
When placing <style=Highlight_Teaching>wall</style> furniture, you need to be <style=Highlight_Teaching>close to a wall</style>.
When placing <style=Highlight_Teaching>roof</style> furniture, you need to be <style=Highlight_Teaching>close to the ceiling</style>.

While in the Starsea, you can navigate with the <style=Highlight_Teaching>left joystick</style>.
You can check the locations of nearby Islets on the <style=Highlight_Teaching>mini-map</style>, where <style=Highlight_Teaching>question marks</style> indicate unexplored Islets.
<style=Highlight_Teaching>Enter Islets</style> to collect materials and possibly encounter new Neighbors.

Participate in the bazaar stage gameplay to earn <style=Highlight_Teaching>Bazaar Jellies</style>.
You can exchange them for rewards at the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Prize Kiosk</style> near the stage.

You can earn Dough by selling surplus <style=Highlight_Teaching>insects</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>fish</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>shore-dwellers</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>produce</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>dishes</style>, and other materials like <style=Highlight_Teaching>wildgrass</style> at Glenn's Goods.

You can earn Dough by selling surplus <style=Highlight_Teaching>insects</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>fish</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>shore-dwellers</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>produce</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>dishes</style>, and other materials like <style=Highlight_Teaching>wildgrass</style> at Glenn's Goods.

While in Decorate Mode, <style=Highlight_Teaching>use WASD</style> to move the camera, and <style=Highlight_Teaching>hold right-click to drag</style> and rotate it.

<style=Highlight_Teaching>Click</style> to select furniture.
Click <style=Highlight_Teaching>Rotate or Store</style> to perform the corresponding actions with the furniture, or <style=Highlight_Teaching>click on any empty space</style> to deselect it.
Switch to <style=Highlight_Teaching>Top View</style> to place ceiling decorations.

<style=Highlight_Teaching>Tap</style> to select furniture.
Tap <style=Highlight_Teaching>Rotate or Store</style> to perform the corresponding actions with the furniture, or <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap on any empty space</style> to deselect it.
Switch to <style=Highlight_Teaching>Top View</style> to place ceiling decorations.

Before planting, you need to purchase seed packets from the shop.
Select the shovel from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>.
<style=Highlight_Teaching>Press T</style> to enter Precision Farming mode.
Select the seeds you want to plant from your Backpack, face the plot you want to cultivate, and <style=Highlight_Teaching>left-click</style> to plant the seeds.

Before planting, you need to purchase seed packets from the shop.
Select the shovel from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>.
<style=Highlight_Teaching>Tap the Precision Farming mode button</style> to enter Precision Farming mode.
Select the seeds you want to plant from your Backpack, face the plot you want to cultivate, and <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the shovel button</style> to plant the seeds.

Select the watering bucket from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>.
Face the plot you want to water and <style=Highlight_Teaching>left-click</style> to water it.
You can <style=Highlight_Teaching>press T</style> to enter Precision Farming mode.
The watering bucket can water up to 3 tiles at once. The soil will be saturated after watering.

Select the watering bucket from the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Tool Wheel</style>.
Face the plot you want to water and <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the watering bucket button</style> to water it.
You can <style=Highlight_Teaching>tap the Precision Farming mode button</style> to enter Precision Farming mode.
The watering bucket can water up to 3 tiles at once. The soil will be saturated after watering.

Keeping the soil moist is the key to growing giant crops.
After planting crop seeds, </style>water them daily</style>, and when they mature, they might grow into giant crops.

Keeping the soil moist is the key to growing giant crops.
After planting crop seeds, </style>water them daily</style>, and when they mature, they might grow into giant crops.

There's a greater chance of producing mutated crops through </style>mixed cropping</style>.
To practice mixed cropping, simply plant different types of crops next to each other.
When you water these mixed fields daily, they might produce crops with unusual colors or shapes.

There's a greater chance of producing mutated crops through </style>mixed cropping</style>.
To practice mixed cropping, simply plant different types of crops next to each other.
When you water these mixed fields daily, they might produce crops with unusual colors or shapes.

Bizarre crops are more likely to appear near giant crops and mutated crops.
When mature <style=Highlight_Teaching>giant crops</style> and <style=Highlight_Teaching>mutated crops</style> are both present nearby, crops in the vicinity may mature into the highest-tier crops  bizarre crops.

Bizarre crops are more likely to appear near giant crops and mutated crops.
When mature <style=Highlight_Teaching>giant crops</style> and <style=Highlight_Teaching>mutated crops</style> are both present nearby, crops in the vicinity may mature into the highest-tier crops  bizarre crops.

When the fields experience prolonged drought, </style>pests</style> may appear when crops mature. Their presence makes it harder for crops to produce high-quality yields.
When pests appear, you can catch them using an insect net.
Keep watering your fields and maintain moisture to keep pests away!

When the fields experience prolonged drought, </style>pests</style> may appear when crops mature. Their presence makes it harder for crops to produce high-quality yields.
When pests appear, you can catch them using an insect net.
Keep watering your fields and maintain moisture to keep pests away!

The Ol' Trusty Scarecrow can help watch over your fields.
Place one next to the fields, approach it, and open the Manage Field panel to check crop information for all connected plots nearby.

The Ol' Trusty Scarecrow can help watch over your fields.
Place one next to the fields, approach it, and open the Manage Field panel to check crop information for all connected plots nearby.

The farming plots on each planet need Luca vitality to grow better plants.
The planet is limited to 60 farming plots to start. Through watering the Luca Arbor with jars of Luca, you can help the planet grow and increase the number of available farming plots.

During Starsea Voyages, your vehicle consumes <style=Highlight_Teaching>battery</style> power while driving. Landing on an Islet also consumes a certain amount of power.
Each voyage requires a <style=Highlight_Teaching>Lumia Battery</style>, which can be purchased from the Store in Loomi Mart with limited daily purchases.
You can <style=Highlight_Teaching>upgrade and modify</style> your vehicle to increase its Battery Pack capacity, allowing you to venture deeper into the Starsea.

During Starsea Voyages, your vehicle consumes <style=Highlight_Teaching>battery</style> power while driving. Landing on an Islet also consumes a certain amount of power.
Each voyage requires a <style=Highlight_Teaching>Lumia Battery</style>, which can be purchased from the Store in Loomi Mart with limited daily purchases.
You can <style=Highlight_Teaching>upgrade and modify</style> your vehicle to increase its Battery Pack capacity, allowing you to venture deeper into the Starsea.

During your Starsea Voyage, use the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Lumia Booster</style> to temporarily increase your driving speed.
Lumia Boosters are consumed after a single use. You can increase the number of Lumia Boosters through vehicle <style=Highlight_Teaching>upgrades and modifications</style>.

During your Starsea Voyage, use the <style=Highlight_Teaching>Lumia Booster</style> to temporarily increase your driving speed.
Lumia Boosters are consumed after a single use. You can increase the number of Lumia Boosters through vehicle <style=Highlight_Teaching>upgrades and modifications</style>.

Higher star strata require a more powerful engine to reach.
In vehicle <style=Highlight_Teaching>upgrades and modifications</style>, upgrade your engine level to reach higher star strata.

Higher star strata require a more powerful engine to reach.
In vehicle <style=Highlight_Teaching>upgrades and modifications</style>, upgrade your engine level to reach higher star strata.

<style=Highlight_Teaching>Planetmaker</style> has multiple building modes.
In <style=Highlight_Teaching>Item Mode</style>, you can <style=Highlight_Teaching>place, move, and store</style> items.

<style=Highlight_Teaching>Planetmaker</style> has multiple building modes.
In <style=Highlight_Teaching>Item Mode</style>, you can <style=Highlight_Teaching>place, move, and store</style> items.

In <style=Highlight_Teaching>Path Mode</style>, click the <style=Highlight_Teaching>path styles</style> to switch between patterns.
Switch between <style=Highlight_Teaching>Edit</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>Clear</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>Refine Edge</style>, and <style=Highlight_Teaching>Move Item</style>, and adjust the <style=Highlight_Teaching>brush size</style> to your liking.

In <style=Highlight_Teaching>Path Mode</style>, click the <style=Highlight_Teaching>path styles</style> to switch between patterns.
Switch between <style=Highlight_Teaching>Edit</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>Clear</style>, <style=Highlight_Teaching>Refine Edge</style>, and <style=Highlight_Teaching>Move Item</style>, and adjust the <style=Highlight_Teaching>brush size</style> to your liking.

In <style=Highlight_Teaching>Cliff Mode</style> or <style=Highlight_Teaching>Water Mode</style>, you can modify the landscape.
1. Up to <style=Highlight_Teaching>eight layers</style> of cliffs can be built.
2. For every three layers added, the cliff will recede inward by one tile.
3. Waterfalls must be built along the middle section of the cliff.

In <style=Highlight_Teaching>Cliff Mode</style> or <style=Highlight_Teaching>Water Mode</style>, you can modify the landscape.
1. Up to <style=Highlight_Teaching>eight layers</style> of cliffs can be built.
2. For every three layers added, the cliff will recede inward by one tile.
3. Waterfalls must be built along the middle section of the cliff.

Near cliffs, you can build pathways using <style=Highlight_Teaching>ramps</style>.
Take out a ramp from your Backpack, find a suitable placement area, and click <style=Highlight_Teaching>Confirm</style> to create a path.
You can rotate and move it to find the best position.
The higher end of the ramp must be inserted into a cliff for proper placement.
